intro: Rorippa nuttallii, commonly known as the Nuttall's watercress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard family plants. This herbaceous annual typically grows in moist environments such as stream banks and wet meadows. Its small, edible leaves are often used in salads, and it produces small white or yellow flowers. The plant has a shallow root system and is adapted to thrive in waterlogged soils.
